title: Sustainable Supply Chain Management (SCM) Professional Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic supply chain management theory, practical experience, and understanding of sustainability concepts
context.additional_context: SDGs-linked practical competency emphasis for current practitioners, learning real-world problem-solving through COVID-19 case studies

learning_goals: Learners can design sustainability strategies applying the Triple Bottom Line (economic, social, environmental) principles in supply chain operations.
Learners can propose innovative solutions to real-world SCM problems through experiential learning activities based on the ADDIE model.
Learners can evaluate supply chain improvement plans linked to the SDGs (Sustainable Development Goals) and derive continuous improvement measures using the PDCA cycle.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
